Our US$1M donation supported 
Decent Jobs for Egypt’s Young 
People, a three-year Damietta-
based program to create jobs, 
promote entrepreneurship, 
facilitate job matching and 
build capacities of local service 
providers to unemployed youth. 
Methanex extended the project for an additional 
year with a donation of $350,000 to embed 
elements of the program in the Damietta 
community and institutions, helping to ensure  
the sustainability of the program for years to come. 
We also partnered with the 
National Council for Women to 
offer “Training the Trainers”, a 
program to train businesswomen 
from Damietta who run a 
community-based program for 
women entrepreneurs. 
We facilitated the signing of a 
Memorandum of Understanding 
with Damietta’s private Horus 
University Egypt and Damietta 
Governorate to establish an 
Entrepreneurship Hub to offer 
the entrepreneurship elements 
of the program to students  
and graduates. 
Since 2019, Methanex has partnered with the International Labour 
Organization (ILO) in Egypt to support young women and men in their 
quest for better lives and decent work.
